get.description: This API endpoint allows users to fetch a list of tasks available within the organization and retrieves task data relying on the user's permissions stored in the user token. It provides access to tasks granted by the user's specific permissions, allowing access to all relevant tasks according to the user's role, team assignments, or tasks directly assigned to the user.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `startTime,endTime,hubId,createdBy,flow,status`

parameters.name: flow
parameters.description:
List flow name that user need to get, string with comma `(,)` delimiter.
Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit,Delivery,Pickup`

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the flow that generated by system. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow id.
Comma (,) delimiter for filter multiple flow.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86,73d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd87`

parameters.name: doneBy
parameters.description:
Name of user that completing the task.
**Example:** `Leandro`

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description:
User email for a given task.
**Example**: `leandro@mile.app`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Status of task according to task's data condition. There are 3 types of `status`:
**enum**: `UNASSIGNED`,`ONGOING`,`DONE`
**Example:** `UNASSIGNED`

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
state of active means we only need to retrieve tasks which startTime and endTime is still relevant with the current time.
**Example:** `true`

parameters.name: isVisit
parameters.description:
state of visit means we only need to retrieve tasks which endTime is still relevant with the current time.
**Example:** `true`

parameters.name: routingResultId
parameters.description:
This key is related to the routing process. When a visit success dispatches the routingResultId will exist on task body.
**Example:** `66791ba47b28d74dab531db2`

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field.
**Example:** `createdTime`,`orderIndex`,`startTime`,`doneTime`
**Default:** `createdTime`

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

parameters.name: timeBy
parameters.description:
Optional filter to range data between one of the following options :
**enum**: `createdTime`,`startTime`,`doneTime`
**Example:** `startTime`

parameters.name: timeFrom
parameters.description:
Used to set the start limit of the data range to retrieve based on `timeBy` with format `(Y-m-d H:i:s)`
**Example:** `2023-01-01 00:00:00`

parameters.name: timeTo
parameters.description:
Used to set the end limit of the data range to retrieve based on `timeBy` with format `(Y-m-d H:i:s)`
**Example:** `2023-01-01 23:59:59`

parameters.name: lazyLoad
parameters.description:
Used to set the lazy load mode or cursor method pagination for the task list. If set to `1`, it will ignore `page` parameter and using cursor parameter for pagination.
**Example:** `1`

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
Used in conjunction with `lazyLoad` parameter. If `lazyLoad` is set to `1`, this parameter will be used to get the next page of data. The value should be the last task ID 
**Example:** `670391525629320817090499`

parameters.name: taskType
parameters.description:
Filter tasks by their type to retrieve specific categories of tasks.
**Enum:**
• `task` - Regular standalone task
• `taskMaster` - Parent task containing multiple subtasks
• `taskChild` - Subtask belonging to a parent task
• `activityMaster` - Main activity containing workflow steps
• `activityChild` - Individual step within an activity workflow
**Example:** `taskMaster`
Use comma to filter multiple types.
**Example:** `taskMaster,activityMaster`

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description:
Filter tasks by parent task ID to retrieve all child tasks belonging to a specific parent.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86`

status.description: Status of response.

message.description: Message of API response.

status.description: Shows if the request was successful.

message.description: A short message explaining what went wrong.

status.description: Shows if the request was successful.

message.description: A short message explaining what went wrong.

example.message: Internal server error, please contact support@mile.app.

get.description: This API endpoint allows users to fetch a list of tasks that contain photos within the organization. The retrieved task data is based on the user's permissions stored in the user token. It filters tasks to only include those with associated photos, ensuring users access relevant tasks that contain visual documentation.

get.description: This API is designed to provide an overview of worker performance within a specific time. It enables monitoring of task completion rates, ongoing tasks, and travel metrics such as distance covered and time spent on tasks. The data is aggregated across all workers, with detailed statistics available for individual workers to facilitate in-depth analysis. The primary purpose is to track the number of tasks each worker has completed or is currently working on within the specified date. Additionally, it measures productivity by calculating the time spent on tasks and the distances traveled during task execution.

get.description: Export logs only appear for the past 30 days and displays log data based on the user's email from the token.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field. The value of this param is one of available fields on log export objects.
**Default:** `exportAt`

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

parameters.name: dataType
parameters.description:
Type to identify the export log. 
**Example:** `task`

parameters.name: dataName
parameters.description:
The name of the file resulting from the export process.
**Example:** `task_6448e1c545193f0ee62de373_171367789465`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
The status indicates the progress of the export process. There are 3 logs :
 `Processing` indicates that the file export process is currently underway. 
 `Available` indicates that the file export process has completed, and the exported file is ready for download.  
 `Failed` indicates that the file export process has failed, and you can view the error message in the response.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description:
User email requesting export task. By default, use the user's email from the token. 
**Example:** `john@mile.app`

requestBody.description:
The API payloads for creating a task may differ from other API payloads, as tasks are parts of a flow, thus their attributes dynamically adjust to the respective task's flow. There are 2 easy ways to easily create a task payload:

### Generate payload from API

1. Send request to endpoint [GET /flow/{flowName}/task](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload)
2. Copy the response from section `bodyRequest`

### Generate payload from UI

1. Visit https://web.mile.app/flow/flow
2. Select a Flow
3. Open the **Configuration** tab
4. Click **API Example**
5. Finally, a complete description will appear to create a task according to the chosen flow
6. You can also click **Copy Curl** to copy the generated request body based on the selected flow, which can be used to create a task

patch.description:
Partially updates a task by providing only the fields that need to be changed. This endpoint allows selective field updates without affecting other task properties.

**Activity Sequence Validation:**
For tasks with `taskType: 'activityChild'` (workflow step tasks), when updating status to `DONE`, the system validates that the previous workflow step has been completed first. If the previous task is not in `DONE` status, the update will be rejected with a detailed error message showing:
- Previous task flow name
- Previous task title

This validation ensures workflow steps are completed in the correct sequential order. The error message is localized and available in 8 languages (en, id, jp, ko, th, tl, vi, zh) via translation key: `activity_sequence_invalid_detailed`.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the task that generated by system.
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

status.description: Status of response.

message.description: Message of API response.

status.description: Status of response (false for errors)

message.description: Error message

failedCode.description:
Error code

**`task-032`** - General validation error (invalid request payload or field validation failed)

**`activ-037`** - Activity sequence validation failed. Occurs when attempting to finish an `activityChild` task (set status to `DONE`) while the previous workflow step is not completed yet. The error message includes:
- Previous task flow name
- Previous task title

Translation key: `activity_sequence_invalid_detailed` (Available in 8 languages: en, id, jp, ko, th, tl, vi, zh)

parameters.name: startFinish
parameters.description: when the value is `true` the start finish record will be show, if the value is `false` it only displays the location history record.

status.description: Status of response.

message.description: Message of API response.

post.description:
Location history data is transmitted from the MileApp Field mobile app or through the API. This data is sent regularly from the mobile app if the 'Start Finish' feature is active, based on the permission settings associated with the user's role.
There are two primary types of location history data:

**1. Standard Location History**
This type of location history includes essential information such as IDs, email, latitude, longitude, speed, distance, duration, and timestamp.

**2. Start Finish Location History**
For this type of location history, the data structure expands to include additional details:
- IDs
- Email
- Latitude
- Longitude
- Speed
- Distance
- Duration
- Timestamp
- Start Time
- Finish Time
- Finish Latitude
- Finish Longitude
- Notes
- Data Object

Location history data plays a crucial role in the MileApp web application. It is primarily used within the 'Task/Tracking' menu to monitor field user-assigned tasks on a map. This functionality allows users to track the journey of field personnel in real-time, providing valuable insights into their movements and progress.

put.summary: Update location history by email & createdTime

post.description: This API enables mobile devices to create multiple location history entries in bulk. This feature is particularly useful when users are in offline mode and need to store location data locally, syncing it with the server when they regain internet connectivity. The request body should contain a single field location_histories, which is a list of location history entries. Maximum Limit: You can submit a maximum of 1000 location history entries in a single request. Each entry is represented as an object with the following fields:

parameters.name: loc_history_id
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the location history
that generated by system.
**Example**: `634e98098ce07d29474a7e22_example@mile.app_1675224349343`

post.description: Creates an activity from a workflow template. An activity represents a workflow execution instance with multiple tasks created based on workflow steps.

hubIdInPath.name: hubId
hubIdInPath.description:
Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use Use [**GET /hubs**](#tag/Hub/operation/getHubs) endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

hubIdInQuery.name: hubId
hubIdInQuery.description:
Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use Use [**GET /hubs**](#tag/Hub/operation/getHubs) endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

limitInQuery.name: limit
limitInQuery.description: Specifies the maximum number of items to retrieve in a single request. **Example:** `10`

pageInQuery.name: page
pageInQuery.description: The page number of results to retrieve. **Example:** `2`

bearerAuth.description: Use a valid Bearer token to authenticate.

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use [GET /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

field1.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use [GET /flow/{flowName}/task API](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload) to get example of payload.
**Example:** `Jack Ward`

field2.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use [GET /flow/{flowName}/task API](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload) to get example of payload.
**Example:** `Gambir Jakarta`

field3.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use [GET /flow/{flowName}/task API](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload) to get example of payload.
**Example:** `-6.230815251,106.75684387`

startTime.description:
Start time refers to the designated time for users to begin a task. If `startTime` is not provided, it will default to the configured time in the flow. You can view the datetime format here.
**Example:** `2022-11-02T07:28:23+00:00`

endTime.description:
End time is the deadline for completing a task. If `endTime` is not specified, it will default to the configured time in the flow.The task cannot be completed if the date has passed the `endtime`. You can view the datetime format here
**Example:** `2022-11-05T07:28:23+00:00`

assignee.description:
You can assign tasks using user email according to their task hub.  To assign tasks to multiple users, use a comma (',') as a separator.
**Example:** `['leandro@mile.app']`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use [GET /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

field1.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use [GET /flow/{flowName}/task API](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload) to get example of payload.
**Example:** `John Birdy`

field2.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use [GET /flow/{flowName}/task API](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload) to get example of payload.
**Example:** `Gambir Jakarta`

field3.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use [GET /flow/{flowName}/task API](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload) to get example of payload.
**Example:** `-6.230815251,106.75684387`

startTime.description:
Start time refers to the designated time for users to begin a task. If `startTime` is not provided, it will default to the configured time in the flow. You can view the datetime format here.
**Example:** `2022-11-02T07:28:23+00:00`

endTime.description:
End time is the deadline for completing a task. If `endTime` is not specified, it will default to the configured time in the flow.The task cannot be completed if the date has passed the `endtime`. You can view the datetime format here
**Example:** `2022-11-05T07:28:23+00:00`

assignee.description:
You can assign tasks using user email according to their task hub.  To assign tasks to multiple users, use a comma (',') as a separator.
**Example:** `['leandro@mile.app']`

field1.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use [GET /flow/{flowName}/task API](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload) to get example of payload.
**Example:** `Jack Ward`

assignee.description:
You can assign tasks using user email according to their task hub.  To assign tasks to multiple users, use a comma (',') as a separator.
**Example:** `['leandro@mile.app']`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

background.description:
When the background parameter is set to `true` , the action will be processed in the background. In this mode, the API call will return quickly with a response indicating that the create task request has been received and is being processed asynchronously in the background. When the background parameter is set to `false` (default), the create task will be processed directly via API. This means that the API call will wait for the create task process to complete before returning the results to the user. 
 **Default:** `false`.

tasks.description: The maximum data for creating multiple tasks is 2000 data.

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use [GET /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

**Example:** `2022-11-05T07:28:23+00:00`

assignee.description:
You can assign tasks using user email according to their task hub.  To assign tasks to multiple users, use a comma (',') as a separator.
**Example:** `['leandro@mile.app']`

refId.description:
You can add `refId` to return a value as a task reference .
**Example:** `66544e0855d2696d401d8252`

_id.description:
An identity that is automatically generated as a technical identification of a task.
**Example:** `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

field1.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use [GET /flow/{flowName}/task API](#tag/Flow/operation/getCreateTaskPayload) to get example of payload.
**Example:** `Jack Ward`

_id.description:
An identity that is automatically generated as a technical identification of a task.
**Example:** `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

An identity that is automatically generated as a technical identification of a task.
**Example:** `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

assignee.description:
List of username that has been assigned the task.
**Example:** `['leandro@mile.app']`

_id.description:
An identity that is automatically generated as a technical identification of a task.
**Example:** `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

download.description:
File type that user want to download. There are 2 types of `download`:
**enum**: `json`,`xlsx`
**Example:** `xlsx`

fields.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `startTime,endTime,hubId,createdBy,flow,status`

doneBy.description:
Name of user that completing the task.
**Example:** `Leandro`

assignee.description:
User email for a given task.
**Example**: `leandro@mile.app`

status.description:
Status of task according to task's data condition. There are 3 types of `status`:
**enum**: `UNASSIGNED`,`ONGOING`,`DONE`
**Example:** `UNASSIGNED`

flowId.description:
The identifier for the flow that generated by system. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow id.
Comma (,) delimiter for filter multiple flow.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86,73d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd87`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

sortBy.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field. The value of this param is one of available fields on vehicle objects.
**Example:** `flow`, `assignee`, `status`, `hubId`, etc.
**Default:** `createdTime`

sortOrder.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

background.description:
If the user sets the background parameter to `true`, the export process will utilize background processing, and the results will be available at [GET /tasks/export-log API](#tag/Task/operation/GetLogExport). If the user sets the background parameter to `false`, the export process will run directly, and the results will be immediately available in the response .
**Example:** `true`.
**Default:** `false`

exportConfigId.description:
Unique identifier for the export config for allow user to export data using their own configuration. Use [**GET /export-configs**](#tag/Export-Config/operation/getExportConfigs) endpoint to get the list of Export Config IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

email.description: Required, User's email assigned to the monitored task. **Example:** `example@mile.app`

taskId.description: Unique ID to identify the task. **Example:** `634e98098ce69d29474a7e11`

speed.description: Vehicle speed in kilometers per hour. **Example:** `40`

distance.description: Distance traveled from the previous location. **Example:** `40`

duration.description: Time duration spent at this location in milliseconds. **Example:** `50`

lat.description: Required, Latitude coordinate position or location of any place on Earth's surface. **Example:** `-6.1771046`

lon.description: Required, Longitude coordinate position or location of any place on Earth's surface. **Example:** `106.9240199`

createdTime.description: Time at which the location history was created. **Example:** `2022-10-07 03:00:58`

startTime.description: Time at which the start working was created. Include this payload when starting work. **Example:** `2022-10-07 03:00:58`

finishTime.description: Time at which the finish working was created. Include this payload when finishing work. **Example:** `2022-10-07 03:00:58`

notes.description: Field for written records used to capture and retain important information. **Example:** `Example notes`

data.description: This is a free object that you can fill with any data in object format. **Example:** `{'temperature': 31, 'anotherKey': 'anotherValue'}`

email.description: Required, User's email assigned to the monitored task. **Example:** `example@mile.app`

taskId.description: Unique ID to identify the task. **Example:** `634e98098ce69d29474a7e11`

speed.description: Vehicle speed in kilometers per hour. **Example:** `40`

distance.description: Distance traveled from the previous location. **Example:** `50`

duration.description: Time duration spent at this location in milliseconds. **Example:** `50`

distance.description: Distance traveled from the previous location. **Example:** `10`

taskId.description: Unique ID to identify the task. **Example:** `634e98098ce69d29474a7e11`

speed.description: Vehicle speed in kilometers per hour. **Example:** `40`

force.description: Flag indicating whether to force delete. **Example:** `false`

status.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

message.description: A message providing additional information about the response.

email.description: User's email assigned to the monitored task.

speed.description: Vehicle speed in kilometers per hour.

distance.description: Distance traveled from the previous location.

duration.description: Time duration spent at this location in milliseconds.

createdTime.description: Time at which the location history was created.

_id.description: Unique identifier for the location history entry.

taskId.description: Unique ID to identify the task.

time.description: A timestamp indicating the time of the location history entry.

updatedBy.description: Email of the user who last updated the location history entry.

createdBy.description: Email of the user who created the location history entry.

updatedTime.description: Time at which the location history entry was last updated.

location_histories.description: Array of responses for each location history entry.

status.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful.

message.description: A message providing additional information about the operation.

_id.description: Unique identifier for the location history entry.

email.description: User's email assigned to the monitored task.

status.description: Indicates whether the recalculation was successful.

message.description: A message providing additional information about the recalculation.

background.description: Indicates whether the recalculation was performed in the background.

result.description: Array of detailed results for each segment of the location history.

coordinates.description: Array of coordinate pairs used in the recalculation.

countryCode.description: Country code associated with the coordinates.

status.description: Indicates whether the recalculation for this segment was successful.

message.description: A message providing additional information about the recalculation result.

data.description: Array of distance and time data for each segment.

coordinateOrigin.description: The origin coordinates in the format 'latitude,longitude'.

coordinateDestination.description: The destination coordinates in the format 'latitude,longitude'.

background.description: Indicates whether the operation was performed in the background.

locationHistoryId.description: The ID associated with the location history.

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

name.description:
The name of task schedule. User can define task schedule name with task's flow name combined with running time, or something else.
**Example**: `Daily Morning Visit`

periode.description:
There are 5 types of periode: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly**, **byDate**, **custom**. Period of time when the task scheduler running.
**Example:** `daily`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

flowId.description:
The Identifier of organization's flow. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow ids.
**Example:** `67be687c128306111e022022`

startTime.description:
Start date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly** 
**Example:** `2022-11-02`

endTime.description:
End date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of: **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly** 
**Example:** `2022-11-05`

task.description:
data of task according to selected flow.
**Example:** 
`{`
`'receiverName':'miguel',`
`'coordinates':'-6.230815251,106.75684387',`
`'address':'rawamangun jakarta timur'`
`}`

assignee.description: List of user email that will be assigned to the generated task. **Example:** `['jhon@sample.com']`

interval.description:
Number units of frequency between each scheduled execution. For example, an interval of 2 with a frequency of daily means the task will run every 2 days. This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

frequency.description:
Specified unit of time for the scheduling interval. Determines how often the scheduled task will run based on the interval value.This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

schedules.description: Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.

time.description: Time of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `07:00`

schedules.description: Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.

day.description: Day of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `sunday`

time.description: Time of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `07:00`

date.description: Date of the task schedule will be executed. **Example:** `10`

hubId.description:
The identifier for the hub that generated by system. Use [GET /hubs API](#tag/Hub) to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

name.description:
The name of task schedule. User can define task schedule name with task's flow name combined with running time, or something else.
**Example**: `Daily Morning Visit`

periode.description:
There are 5 types of periode: `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`, `byDate`, `custom`. Period of time when the task scheduler running.
**Example:** `daily`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

startTime.description:
Start date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of:
`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly` 
**Example:** `2022-11-02`

endTime.description:
End date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of:
`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly` 
**Example:** `2022-11-05`

task.description:
data of task according to selected flow.
**Example:** 
`{`
`'receiverName':'miguel',`
`'coordinates':'-6.230815251,106.75684387',`
`'address':'rawamangun jakarta timur'`
`}`

schedules.description:
Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.
**Example for periode of** `daily`:
`[{`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `weekly`:
`[{`
`'day':'sunday',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `monthly`:
`[{`
`'date':'1',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `byDate`:
`[{`
`'date':'2022-11-03',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`

day.description:
Name of day in a week. `day` is required when *periode* value is `weekly`.
**Example:** `sunday`

time.description:
Time of the task schedule will be executed.
**Example:** `07:00`

date.description:
Date of task schedule will be executed. `date` is required when *periode* value is `monthly` or `byDate`.
**Example for monthly periode**: `1`
**Example for byDate periode**: `2022-11-03`

**Example:** `sunday`

time.description:
Time of the task schedule will be executed.
**Example:** `07:00`

date.description:
Date of task schedule will be executed. `date` is required when *periode* value is `monthly` or `byDate`.
**Example for monthly periode**: `1`
**Example for byDate periode**: `2022-11-03`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

name.description:
The name of task schedule. User can define task schedule name with task's flow name combined with running time, or something else.
**Example**: `Daily Morning Visit`

periode.description:
There are 5 types of periode: `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`, `byDate`, `custom`. Period of time when the task scheduler running.
**Example:** `daily`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

startTime.description:
Start date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of:
`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly` 
**Example:** `2022-11-02`

endTime.description:
End date of task scheduler to active. this field only available when periode's value is one of:
`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly` 
**Example:** `2022-11-05`

task.description:
data of task according to selected flow.
**Example:** 
`{`
`'receiverName':'miguel',`
`'coordinates':'-6.230815251,106.75684387',`
`'address':'rawamangun jakarta timur'`
`}`

interval.description:
Number units of frequency between each scheduled execution. For example, an interval of 2 with a frequency of daily means the task will run every 2 days. This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

frequency.description:
Specified unit of time for the scheduling interval. Determines how often the scheduled task will run based on the interval value.This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

schedules.description:
Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.
**Example for periode of** `daily`:
`[{`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `weekly`:
`[{`
`'day':'sunday',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `monthly`:
`[{`
`'date':'1',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `byDate`:
`[{`
`'date':'2022-11-03',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`

day.description:
Name of day in a week. `day` is required when *periode* value is `weekly`.
**Example:** `sunday`

time.description:
Time of the task schedule will be executed.
**Example:** `07:00`

date.description:
Date of task schedule will be executed. `date` is required when *periode* value is `monthly` or `byDate`.
**Example for monthly periode**: `1`
**Example for byDate periode**: `2022-11-03`

example.name: Report Daily
example.description: Template for daily report with bill item detail

name.description:
The name of export config. Name must be unique.
**Example**: `Report Daily`

collection.description:
The collection from which the data will be exported.
**Example**: `task`

flowIds.description:
The flow identifier used to filter the components refers only to the selected flow IDs. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow id.
**Example:** `['66a988d53ae08a7ab52867c2']`

fields.description:
The optional fields to be included in the exported data that ref to Flow reserved key and User fields. 
 **To see the details of reserved key of task, please follow [ this link ](#tag/task_model)**

id.description: An unique identifier for flow component. The value that cannot be input is the reserved key task.

name.description:
The name of export config. Name must be unique.
**Example**: `Report Daily`

collection.description:
The collection from which the data will be exported.
**Example**: `task`

flowIds.description:
The flow identifier used to filter the components refers only to the selected flow IDs. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow id.
**Example:** `['66a988d53ae08a7ab52867c2']`

fields.description:
The optional fields to be included in the exported data that ref to Flow reserved key and User fields. 
 **To see the details of reserved key of task, please follow [ this link ](#tag/task_model)**

id.description: An unique identifier for flow component. The value that cannot be input is the reserved key task.

workflowId.description: Workflow ID to create activity from

tasks.description: Task configurations for each workflow step

items.description: Task data corresponding to workflow step order

_id.description: Activity ID (actually a task ID with taskType='activityMaster')

workflow.description: Embedded workflow object for performance optimization

steps.description: Array of workflow steps with field mappings and schemas

hub.description: Populated hub object with complete location data

status.description: Activity status

tasks.description: Array of task IDs created for this activity (activityChild tasks)

subId.description: Same as tasks - array of child task IDs (for consistency with task model)

updatedTime.description: Last update timestamp in ISO 8601 format
